children.text: The studs in this area are spaced at greater than 600mm centres, which will not properly support the plasterboard sheets.
The relevant Australian Standards AS 1684 and AS 2589.1, and the plaster manufacturer all require that the wall framing members be spaced at maximum 600mm centres for wall plasterboard.
A stud, or trimmers will need to be installed so that the plasterboard sheets can be securely fixed to the framing at their required centres.
